hero.title: No distractions
hero.text: The web is a busy place, and it's not doing you any good. Experience it in a way that helps you stay focused and calm.

facets.title: Read without distraction
facets.text: Read articles like they are articles, not interactive (and manipulative) experiences.

facets.title: Stay focused on one thing at a time
facets.text: Instead of a giant list of tabs and alerts telling you what we aren't doing, automatically focus on the one thing you are doing right now.

facets.title: Control your notifications
facets.text: Instead of letting any site poke at you for any reason, notifications are kept to a minimum and batched.

facets.title: Focused writing
facets.text: When you need to focus on what you are saying, not what people are saying to you, enter focused writing mode.

facets.title: Get updates without falling down a news hole
facets.text: Avoid clickbait, don't reload pages, just see updates from the sites you trust

facets.title: Pomodoro: let yourself get distracted... but only a little bit
facets.text: The Pomodoro technique helps you switch between periods of focused work and letting yourself relax

facets.title: Don't even ask
facets.text: Do you want notifications from the news site you visited once? Do you want videos to autoplay? We'll stop even asking.

facets.title: Suggestion-free browsing
facets.text: Every page you look at isn't an invitation to tell you what you should look at next. Remove suggested content, and do what YOU want to do next.

facets.title: Memento Mori
facets.text: Of course the best way to focus is to be constantly reminded that life is fleeting and we must capture everything we can from each moment. Enter your age and each new tab will contain a countdown timer of your life.
